"Nic" Hunter | leader_title1 = City Council | leader_name1 = | unit_pref = Imperial | area_footnotes = | area_total_sq_mi = 48.5 | area_land_sq_mi = 45.7 | area_water_sq_mi = 2.8 | area_total_km2 = 125.5 | area_land_km2 = 118.2 | area_water_km2 = 7.3 | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_ft = 15 | population_footnotes = | population_total = 84872 | population_as_of = 2020 | population_density_sq_mi = auto | population_density_km2 = auto | population_urban = 162501 | population_metro = 254652 | pop_est_as_of = 2024 | pop_est_footnotes = | population_est = 81157 | population_demonym = Lake Charlesian | population_rank = CA: 1st LA: 5th | timezone1 = CST | utc_offset1 = −6 | timezone1_DST = CST | utc_offset1_DST = −5 | postal_code_type = ZIP Codes | postal_code = 70601, 70602, 70605, 70606, 70607, 70609, 70615, 70616, 70629 | area_code_type = Area Code | area_code = 337 | blank1_name_sec2 = Primary airport | blank1_info_sec2 = Lake Charles Regional Airport | blank2_name_sec2 = Interstates | blank2_info_sec2 = | blank3_name_sec2 = U.S. Route | blank3_info_sec2 = | blank4_name_sec2 = Waterways | blank4_info_sec2 = Calcasieu River | website = | footnotes = }} Lake Charles is the most populous city in the southwest Louisiana. It is the second most populous city in the Acadiana (after Lafayette). It is the fifth most populous city in the U.S. state of Louisiana (after New Orleans, Baton Rouge, Shreveport and Lafayette). The actual population is about 85,000. The city was founded as Charleston, March 7, 1861. The name was changed to Lake Charles on March 16, 1867. The city was founded by and named for Charles Sallier. ==References== Category:Cities in Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana Category:Parish seats in Louisiana
